name: Viktualienmarkt
notes: The Viktualienmarkt is a daily food market and a square in the center of Munich, Germany. The Viktualienmarkt developed from an original farmers' market to a popular market for gourmets.

name: Augustiner-Keller Restaurant & Beerhaus
notes: Landmark restaurant known for its large beer garden & hall, serving Bavarian & international dishes.

name: Historic Wurstkuchl
notes: A 900-year old sausage haus with sausages cooked over wood fires

name: Linderhoff Castle
notes: King Ludwig's favorite retreat in the bavarian alps.

name: Niederbayern
notes: This stretch of territory to the East of Munich extends through the Bavarian Forest to the Austrian and Czech borderlands and is one of the least-traveled regions of Germany. That alone makes Lower Bavaria an attractive destination, but the history and culture of beer make it even more appealing.

name: Veteran Henley Regatta
street: Henley Royal Regatta Headquarters, Henley Bridge
notes: Races are on Friday, July 11th & Saturday, 12th. Check with Mike on race times.
